thread.title: Opening date set for Plymouth Meeting Legoland; how Lego's recent successes could boost region's tourism
thread.title_full: Opening date set for Plymouth Meeting Legoland; how Lego's recent successes could boost region's tourism

author: Kenneth Hilario
title: Opening date set for Plymouth Meeting Legoland; how Lego's recent successes could boost region's tourism
text: In 4 months Phila. restaurant tech startup doubles U.S. footprint, big-name clients; grows revenue & staff Mayor Jim Kenney made the announcement on Thursday while unveiling the first Philadelphia landmark to be completed for the Miniland Philadelphia area: A 9-foot model of One Liberty Place made of more than 17,000 Lego bricks, which required about nine builders and took more than 930 hours to complete. Legoland Discovery Center Philadelphia’s Miniland display is an interactive replica of Philadelphia made of about 1.5 million Lego bricks, featuring additional landmarks such as The Comcast Center and City Hall. The Plymouth Meeting Legoland will be only one of nine in the United States, according to Merlin Entertainments, and only the 17th worldwide. A boost to Philadelphia tourism For the Plymouth Meeting Mall, annual visitors would "catalyze an interior re-merchandising effort that will further complement the existing experience," Joseph F. Coradino , CEO of mall owner Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust, said in an earlier statement. The Lego brand's recent successes, however, could also give the region a boost. An Uber for Explorers: La Salle strikes partnership with ride-hailing service "One of the exciting things for the region about the opening of the Legoland Discovery Center in the Plymouth Meeting Mall is Lego's high visibility across different media," said Wesley S. Roehl , professor of tourism management at Temple University’s School of Sport, Tourism & Hospitality Management Lego is a "highly visible brand," with its line of toys, television shows, Legoland Parks, Legoland Discovery Centers, and movies like 2014's The Lego Movie , the recently released The Lego Batman Movie and this September's The Lego Ninjago Movie. The Lego Movie raked in more than $257.7 million in the United States, according to Box Office Mojo, while The Lego Batman Movie has brought in more than $110 million as of Feb. 21. Both films topped the box office. January brings city $5.7M in soda tax revenue "This high level of visibility allows each of these different products to help raise consumer awareness of their other intellectual properties through cross-marketing," Roehl said. "With a Legoland Discovery Center opening in the Philadelphia area, we might expect that regional tourism will benefit from being associated with such a well-known brand that has achieved these high levels of consumer awareness," Roehl added. Along with the "halo effect," it also adds another attraction to the region's inventory of things to see and do. What Philadelphia area companies need to know about strict new cybersecurity regulations "Its opening likely makes the region a little more attractive as a destination but further broadening the base of attractions," Roehl said. The Discovery Center provides two to three hours of repeatable Lego play experiences "that power creativity and learning through shared Lego fun for the entire family," Michael Taylor, general manager of Legoland Discovery Center Philadelphia, said Thursday. The 33,000-square-foot Discovery Center will feature an interactive Lego-themed ride, a 4D Cinema, and thousands of Lego bricks in themed building areas. Ticket information Single day admission passes are available for purchase online starting at $19 per person. Tickets will be available to buy at the door for $24 per person. Annual passes are available for purchase through the Discovery Center’s website. Annual Pass holders receive unlimited access to the attraction for 12 months. Benefits include café, Lego Shop and birthday party discounts. By purchasing an annual pass before March 31, families are given a “First to Play” access with an invitation to the Center’s “First to Play” preview weekend, April 1-2. Annual passes will be on sale for $59 per person after March 31. Kenneth Hilario covers hospitality, restaurants and takes on general assignments and breaking news. Industries
